page.title: 02SCHOOLS AND ENVIRONMENT
page.content: MALDEN MANOR IS A LARGE,CO-EDUCATIONAL JUNIOR SCHOOL BUILT IN 1936.IT HAS A LARGE PLAYGROUND AND PLAYING FIELD. THERE ARE QUITE A FEW TREES SO THE SCHOOL HAS A PLEASANT OUTLOOK. BEVERLEY SCHOOL IS A BOYS' SECONDARY SCHOOL BUILT IN 1931.SINCE THEN IT HAS EXPANDED AND IN 1985 COVERS A LARGE SITE NEXT TO THE A3 ROAD.IT HAS 1,000 PUPILS AND 60 STAFF. CUDDINGTON SCHOOL IS A SMALL MIXED INFANTS SCHOOL NEAR WORCESTER PARK. OUTSIDE THE SCHOOLS ARE MANY ROADS FULL OF HOUSES AND NEARBY ARE SHOPS AND MAIN ROADS.THE HOGSMILL RIVER FLOWS THROUGH THE AREA AND ENTERS THE RIVER THAMES EVENTUALLY. THERE ARE RAILWAY STATIONS WITH TRAINS TO LONDON AND CHESSINGTON.41% OF FATHERS AND 9% OF MOTHERS WORK IN LONDON.OUR AREA IS A COMMUTER SUBURB OF GREATER LONDON.
